class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:

        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        
        h_cost = 1
        v_cost = 1
        
        total_cost = 0
        h_idx = v_idx = 0

        while h_idx < len(horizontalCut) or v_idx < len(verticalCut):
            
            if h_idx < len(horizontalCut) and (v_idx == len(verticalCut) or horizontalCut[h_idx] > verticalCut[v_idx]):
                total_cost += horizontalCut[h_idx] * v_cost
                h_cost += 1
                h_idx += 1
            else:
                total_cost += verticalCut[v_idx] * h_cost
                v_cost += 1
                v_idx += 1

        return total_cost
